intro: Xanthosoma weeksii, commonly known as the giant arrowleaf taro, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can reach up to 1 meter in length. The plant produces clusters of yellow-orange flowers, followed by edible, starchy tubers that are used in various cuisines. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often cultivated for both its ornamental value and nutritional benefits. Xanthosoma weeksii is a member of the Araceae family, which includes other familiar plants like taro and calla lilies.
